column5: Hard water talk....... cant wait. I generally head to simcoe for first trip if conditions allow. If not I will take my daughter, she's been beging to go now for weeks, to Crow Lake just east of Peterborough.
lake simcoe here i come and maybe scugog

Having just moved back to my hometown of Belleville after spending the last five years working in Keswick, I am eager to hit the BOQ for some decent walleyes. When my family was in Keswick we were often on Cook's Bay for perch.
It will be Bancroft area and Brookie's.
I will most likely be at scugog - if there is safe ice    Don

iam making a G2G IN  january for anyone that'd like to join,, iam heading elliot lake for anything that'll bite my line . thinking about staying at dunlop lodge 80% drinking,poker,sledding,20% ice hut sittin. all is welcome.http://www.dunloplodge.com/.
Buster..I've watched you...U better make that 95/5 ! LOL
guess
Little Lk for equipment test and then Simcoe, Nippissing in Jan for a weekend on the lake.

Hi all, Just thinking about the hard water fishing season that is coming up soon, Are you heading back to your favorite lake or is it time for a change ?? I have never fished for Lake Trout, perhaps I should try Lake Temagami.  Having a lake such as Lake Nipissing available is to my liking, never been skunked there. Where are you going and why???????????? Have a great day. Sarmoti,)))))))))))
simcoe or the bog, i cant waittttt!!!!!!!!!
Lake Simcoe and then here at home BOQ.  Regards, Sam
Yeah i always wanted to go to the BOQ but never managed, is the eye action really that good during the hard season? What r some good spots?
Green Lake for first ice Brookies! Nothing will beat that trip, never has, never will.
My first ice lake is a small lake about 10 acres thats stocked with splake then around the haliburtons and when cooks bay has ice mainly there. Cheers jeff
Florida..also my favorite whine. Joe
will head for a few different small lakes just south of parry sound that always issue lots of action for hammerhandles

Keep in mind you can only fish Lakers on Temagami from Feb 15 to Mar 15. This will also LIKELY be the time frame for every other lake North from Nippissings South shore when the new 2007 regs come out...unless the lake has been stocked in the last couple years.
Jan 1 kempenfelt bay ,with my boat because there will not be ice yet

Ive got a trip booked for Nippissing in early Jan will also do a few day trips to Simcoe through-out the winter theres some local holes that i hope also get safe ice - i would love to do a trip north for speckies & splke , but we'll see if that happens

The last couple years we've been spending a weekend on Nosbonsing at Birch Hill Camp. Always a good time.  Unfortunately, Henry and his family are taking a winter off...so we booked at Promised Land Camp on Nippissing (Jan 12-14) for our annual trip.

I'll be going to Simcoe at least once in Feb.  Other than that, I might try up here in Midland and Penetang Bays, and may even make a trip or two to the west arm of Lake Nippising....time will tell, and so will the weather...  Maureen
Same umm er boat as you Jer.We usually go to Birch Hill and are also going to Promised Land the week before you.I'll let you know how we make out.
Lake Simcoe, Cook Bay
I'll be on Simcoe near Beaverton.
Scugog  I have started the count down http://forums.fishontario.com/thread.jspa?...21&tstart=0  Entropy

First ice?  Hmmm, maybe the Bog (like this year), maybe Simcoe.  I'd like to meet up with other OFNers like Ron or JeffW for brookies and/or splake (I've never caught before hard/soft water).  Sending you guys a PM.
Lower niagara river for bows-lakers until next spring.

New Liskeard.  Buddy is almost done is ice hut and I can't wait to get up there for some eye's.  Never caught walleye ice fishign before always just perch, lakers and burbot.  I hope i never catch another burbot again.
ill be hitting simcoe mostly and possibly scugog / northern lakes
Bancroft area for some sqaure tails, Simcoe for the finst perch, and a little north for crappie
I have Lake Nipissing 5 minutes from my place in North Bay , and also will be hitting Nosbonsing , Bernard , Simcoe and the BOG. Hopefully splake up here soon!!! A well rounded season species wise.

Welcome to the board, but please don't start thinking of hard water, with this weeks weather, It'll be soft water for some time.  But, in the event we do get hard water, I will try Simcoe once or twice  John
i dont know any ice fishing spots so im going to valens for some crappie and pike hopefully itll be good lol its goign to be my first year ice fishing so im excited
